page.title: 06SHRIMP FISHING.
page.content: John and his pals come from Flookburgh, which is a village at the other side of the estuary. They had to drive 17 miles round by road to get here. They come especially to fish for shrimps John and his pals wear protective clothing like waders, bib, braces and waterproof suits. Woolly hats cover their ears. John and his mates use big heavy tractors and use big trailers that are attached to the back of the tractors. The trailers have long booms which have nets tied to them. The nets have mesh about a centimetre square and when they are fishing they open out the booms so that the nets are about ten metres wide and about a metre deep. They are dragged along the bottom in upto three metres of water.
